settings.heading: Apple Watch OLED Screen Prices
settings.details:
If your Apple Watch display is black, shows lines, or has blotches under the glass, it likely needs a full OLED screen replacement. This repair replaces the entire display module, including the OLED and touch layer, not just the glass. At iCorrect, we use original pulled Apple Watch screens, tested and restored to meet factory standards.


A full display replacement is the correct solution when both the glass and display are damaged, or when the screen has gone completely dark but the watch still responds or connects to your phone. We reseal your watch to retain liquid resistance, and the result is a restoration that matches the original in both performance and durability.

settings.heading: Our Process
settings.details:
OLED screen replacements on Apple Watch are delicate procedures that must be completed carefully. At iCorrect, we use only original OLED displays removed from donor devices and pass them through a full inspection and testing process before fitting. No aftermarkets. No copy screens.


This is the same screen your Apple Watch left the factory with. That means the same brightness, contrast, and touch sensitivity as you expect from an Apple product. After installation, the adhesive is cured using factory-standard procedures, restoring structural integrity and water resistance.


The repair takes two to three working days due to the curing time needed for the adhesive. We do not rush this step because getting it right is essential. A properly sealed Apple Watch maintains its liquid resistance for daily use like showering, swimming, or getting caught in the rain.

settings.heading: Behind the scenes
settings.subtitle: Watch our videos to understand common repair issues, what to expect, and how we fix your device with care.
settings.video_1_title: Repair your Watch, don't replace it.
settings.video_2_title: Treat your rear glass with care.

settings.heading: Walk-In Service
settings.details: For clients based in Central London who wish to visit us, we operate a  walk-in drop-off service by appointment. Simply book your repair via our  website booking page to confirm your appointment time before heading to us.

settings.heading: London Courier
settings.details: We operate a convenient collection, repair & delivery service for  clients based within Zones 1 & 2 in London. Our couriers are fully  tracked and insured throughout the journey. Book your iPhone repair  before 1pm for a same day return.

settings.heading: National Courier
settings.details: We collect from anywhere in the UK. Book online and we send secure packaging to your door. Your device is returned fully repaired and tested.

settings.heading: Our services
settings.details: Choose the most convenient service for you

settings.heading: How do I know if I need a full Apple Watch screen replacement?
settings.sub_head: If your Apple Watch display is completely black, shows lines, has colour distortion, or shows dark patches under the glass, the OLED layer is damaged and must be replaced. If the touch response is gone or if the display still connects to your phone but shows nothing, it likely needs a full screen replacement.

settings.heading: What does an Apple Watch OLED replacement include?
settings.sub_head: This repair includes a full OLED display module, not just the outer glass. We fit an original pulled screen that includes the OLED panel, touch sensor, and frame. The watch is then resealed and cured for liquid resistance.

settings.heading: What models do you support for full OLED screen replacement?
settings.sub_head: We support OLED screen replacements on Apple Watch Series 4 and newer, including Series 5 through 9, SE, and Ultra models. We inspect every watch before beginning to confirm that a screen replacement is the correct repair.

settings.heading: Do you use original screens or aftermarket parts?
settings.sub_head: We only use original Apple Watch screens pulled from donor devices. These are fully tested, cleaned, and bonded to your watch using Apple-level tools and adhesive. Aftermarket screens are not used, as they do not match the quality, touch sensitivity, or brightness of original parts.

settings.heading: How long does the Apple Watch screen replacement take?
settings.sub_head: Two to three working days. This includes the full disassembly, fitting, curing time, and resealing to retain water resistance. We do not offer same-day repairs for full OLED replacements because skipping these steps can result in poor performance and failed sealing.

settings.heading: Will my Apple Watch still be water resistant after the screen replacement?
settings.sub_head: Yes. We use the same strength adhesive Apple uses during manufacturing, and we reseal the watch to maintain its liquid resistance for daily wear, showering, and swimming. As with all third-party repairs, we recommend avoiding extreme exposure like deep diving.

settings.heading: Why is an OLED screen replacement more expensive than a glass-only repair?
settings.sub_head: Because this is a full module replacement, not a refurbishment. The cost includes the original OLED screen, bonding materials, curing, and testing. It is still significantly more affordable than Apple’s out-of-warranty replacement, which often involves replacing the entire device.

settings.heading: What does your warranty cover on Apple Watch screen replacements?`
settings.sub_head: Our two-year warranty covers any issue related to the screen repair, including touch failure, display problems, adhesive failure, or detachment. It does not cover accidental drops, cracks, or water damage from misuse.

settings.heading: Is it worth repairing my Apple Watch or should I replace it?
settings.sub_head: In most cases, repairing is more cost-effective and better for the environment. Apple charges close to the cost of a new device to replace a broken Apple Watch. If your watch is still functioning except for the screen, a repair restores the value at a fraction of the price.

settings.heading: Can you fix failed repairs from other shops?
settings.sub_head: Yes. We often see Apple Watches that have been opened or fitted with aftermarket screens that quickly fail. If the display was not sealed correctly or the screen is poor quality, we can remove it and replace it with an original part, reseal the device, and test everything to ensure it functions like new.

settings.heading: FAQs
settings.details: Learn more about iCorrect, the essential repair services that we offer and the warranties that come with each repair.
